title: Asset pipeline
description: Convert all game assets from legacy formats to modern equivalents: XPM pixmaps to PNG, .au sound files to WAV. One-time batch conversion preserving identical visuals and audio.

title: Convert XPM pixmaps to PNG
description: Batch convert all XPM files in bitmaps/ subdirectories to PNG format. Preserve exact pixel dimensions and transparency. Maintain directory structure: balls/, bgrnds/, blockex/, blocks/, digits/, eyes/, guides/, guns/, paddle/, presents/, stars/. Verify visual fidelity against originals.

title: Convert .au sound files to WAV
description: Batch convert all 46 .au (Sun audio) files in sounds/ to WAV format. Preserve audio fidelity. Maintain original naming convention (filename without extension used by playSoundFile). Verify all sounds play correctly.

title: Bundle Liberation Sans TTF font
description: Include Liberation Sans (or equivalent Helvetica-alike) TTF in assets. Needed in 4 weights/sizes matching original XLFD fonts. Verify the font is freely redistributable (SIL Open Font License). Place in assets/fonts/.

title: Audio system
description: Replace fork+pipe /dev/dsp audio with SDL2_mixer. Eliminates 12 platform-specific drivers, adds real volume control, automatic backend selection (PipeWire/PulseAudio/ALSA).

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). Audio API surface must be characterized before replacing the driver architecture.

title: Implement SDL2_mixer audio system
description: Replace fork+pipe /dev/dsp architecture with SDL2_mixer. Implement SetUpAudioSystem (Mix_OpenAudio), FreeAudioSystem (Mix_CloseAudio), playSoundFile (Mix_LoadWAV + Mix_PlayChannel). Support concurrent sound playback on multiple channels. ~50 lines replaces 12 drivers + child process.

title: Implement volume control
description: Implement SetMaximumVolume/GetMaximumVolume using Mix_Volume. Support per-channel volume. Wire up +/- key bindings and -maxvol CLI option. Current Linux driver has these as no-ops.

title: Drop K&R C support and modernize code style
description: Remove all NeedFunctionPrototypes guards and K&R-style function definitions. Use C99 throughout. Replace sprintf/strcpy with snprintf/strncpy for buffer safety. Remove dual-prototype #if blocks from all headers. Harden string handling for distro security review.

title: Persistence and configuration
description: Replace binary serialization with JSON for high scores and save files. Add TOML config file at XDG paths. Eliminate htonl/ntohl, flock, struct-based I/O.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). Save/load round-trip and high score format tests must exist before migrating to JSON/SQLite.

title: Implement JSON high score system
description: Replace binary highScoreHeader+highScoreEntry with JSON file. Dual files: global (XDG_DATA_HOME/xboing/scores.json) and personal (~/.local/share/xboing/personal-scores.json). Same 10-entry table, sorted descending. Atomic writes replace flock. Eliminates htonl/ntohl byte order issues.

title: Implement JSON save/load system
description: Replace binary saveGameStruct with JSON file at XDG_DATA_HOME/xboing/savegame.json. Fields: version, score, level, levelTime, gameTime, livesLeft, startLevel, paddleSize, numBullets. Level data saved as separate file in same format. Human-readable, trivially extensible.

title: Implement TOML config file
description: Add config file at XDG_CONFIG_HOME/xboing/config.toml. Persistent preferences: volume, speed, control mode (keys/mouse), nickname, special effects on/off, key bindings. CLI flags override config values. Replaces compile-time defines + env vars for user preferences.

title: Implement CLI option parsing
description: Port command-line options: -display (X11 legacy, maybe drop), -debug, -speed 1-9, -startlevel 1-80, -sound, -keys, -grab, -nickname, -maxvol 1-100, -help, -version, -setup, -scores, -nosfx. Config file values as defaults, CLI overrides.

title: Game mechanics and physics
description: Port ball physics, block system, paddle, gun/bullet, score display, and level loading. Remove X11 types (XPolygonRegion etc), keep all game math and constants identical. Pure C collision regions replace X11 Regions.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). Ball physics, block collision, and scoring characterization tests must pass before and after any mechanics changes.

title: Port ball physics to pure C
description: Port ball.c removing all X11 types. Keep all physics math identical: trig paddle bounce (atan/sin/cos angle calculation), frame-stepped trajectory, velocity clamping (MAX_X_VEL=14, MAX_Y_VEL=14), wall bounce/wrap, quadratic ball-to-ball collision prediction, elastic collision response with mass ratios. Keep BALL struct, 8 states, 5 animation frames, birth/pop sequences. Replace XPM rendering with SDL texture blits.

title: Port block system with pure C collision regions
description: Port blocks.c removing X11 Region dependency. Replace XPolygonRegion with 4 triangles stored as 3 vertices each per block. Replace XRectInRegion with ~10 lines of point-in-triangle math. Keep 18x9 grid, all 30 block types with identical points/behavior, explosion animation (3 frames, EXPLODE_DELAY=10), SHOTS_TO_KILL_SPECIAL=3.

title: Port paddle system
description: Port paddle.c: 3 sizes (SMALL=40, MEDIUM=50, HUGE=70), PADDLE_VEL=10, DIST_BASE=30. Keyboard and mouse control modes. Reverse and sticky special states. Size transitions on power-up blocks. SDL texture rendering for paddle sprites.

title: Port gun and bullet system
description: Port gun.c: MAX_BULLETS=20 ammo, MAX_MOVING_BULLETS=40 in flight, BULLET_DY=-7 upward, BULLET_FRAME_RATE=3. Normal (1 bullet) and fast gun (2 bullets) modes. Tink impact effects (MAX_TINKS=40, TINK_DELAY=100). Bullet-block, bullet-ball, bullet-eyedude collision. NUMBER_OF_BULLETS_NEW_LEVEL=4.

title: Port score display system
description: Port score.c: digit pixmaps (0-9, 30x40 each) rendered as SDL textures. Right-aligned recursive display at score region. ComputeScore with x2/x4 multiplier support. SetTheScore, AddToScore, DisplayScore functions.

title: Port level file loading
description: Port file.c ReadNextLevel: keep identical text format (title, time, 15 rows of 9 chars). Same character-to-block mapping. Use XDG path resolution instead of compile-time LEVEL_INSTALL_DIR. Keep level wrapping at MAX_NUM_LEVELS=80. Background rotation cycling through backgrounds 2-5.

title: Calibrate sleepSync timing for modern CPUs
description: Fix frame timing in misc.c sleepSync() to produce playable speeds on modern multi-GHz CPUs. Original timing constants were tuned for 1993-era hardware. Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Distribution packaging
description: FHS-compliant install targets, .desktop file, AppStream metainfo XML, application icon, .deb packaging via dpkg-buildpackage. Get XBoing into Ubuntu/Debian archives.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing) and xboing-cro (Code quality passes). Distribution packaging requires clean code and passing tests.

title: Create .desktop file and application icon
description: Create xboing.desktop file with proper categories (Game;ArcadeGame;BlocksGame), icon reference, exec path. Create/convert application icon in required sizes (16, 32, 48, 128, 256px) as PNG and SVG. Install to /usr/share/applications/ and /usr/share/icons/.

title: Create AppStream metainfo XML
description: Create com.github.xboing.metainfo.xml with application description, screenshots, categories, release history. Required for GNOME Software / KDE Discover visibility. Validate with appstream-util.

title: Create .deb package configuration
description: Set up debian/ directory: control (dependencies, description), rules (meson build integration), changelog, copyright (original license terms). Build with dpkg-buildpackage. Test install/uninstall on Ubuntu LTS.

title: Add ALSA audio driver
description: New audio/ALSAaudio.c using sox play command for reliable audio playback on modern Linux. Also fix LINUXaudio.c device path from /dev/audio to /dev/dsp for osspd compatibility. Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Safety net infrastructure
description: Build the safety net that makes modernization safe. CMake build system (parallel to existing Makefile), ASan+UBSan sanitizer configurations, CI workflows, clang-format config. Steps 3-6 of the modernization roadmap. ALL porting work is blocked until this is complete.

title: task
description: Create CMakeLists.txt that builds XBoing alongside the existing Makefile. Must produce identical binary. Use pkg-config for X11/Xpm. Enable CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS for clang-tidy. Do NOT remove the Makefile yet — both must coexist until CMake is proven.

title: task
description: Add a CMake preset or build type that compiles with -fsanitize=address,undefined -fno-omit-frame-pointer. Document how to run the sanitizer build. Fix any immediate sanitizer findings in existing code.

title: task
description: Create .clang-format at repo root. BasedOnStyle: LLVM, IndentWidth: 4, ColumnLimit: 100, BreakBeforeBraces: Allman, AllowShortFunctionsOnASingleLine: None, SortIncludes: true. Adjust to match prevailing style in the codebase. Do NOT reformat files yet — this just establishes the config.

title: task
description: Add CMocka as a dependency in CMake. Create tests/ directory with a skeleton test file that compiles and runs via ctest. Verify the test harness works with ctest --test-dir build --output-on-failure.

title: task
description: Create .github/workflows/lint.yml (clang-format, clang-tidy, cppcheck) and test.yml (build + ctest + sanitizer matrix). Pin action versions. Workflows run on push to main and PRs.

title: task
description: Add -Wall -Wextra -Wpedantic -Werror -Wconversion -Wshadow -Wdouble-promotion -Wformat=2 -Wnull-dereference -Wuninitialized -Wstrict-prototypes to CMake. Add per-file warning suppressions for legacy files that do not yet compile clean. Track each suppression as a chore bead to resolve.

title: Fix TrueColor rendering: use gccopy for text and lines
description: Changed DrawLine() and DrawText() in misc.c from triple-draw XOR/AND/XOR pattern (designed for PseudoColor) to single gccopy draw. Fixed white/black color init in init.c to use WhitePixel/BlackPixel instead of colormap lookup. Fixed sleepSync in main.c to only delay during gameplay modes (MODE_GAME/MODE_BALL_WAIT), other modes use XSync without delay for responsive animations. Uncommitted working changes.

title: Fix compilation on modern GCC
description: Fix implicit int declaration in main.c, add missing X11/Xlib.h includes to headers using Display/Window types, make waitMode variables static to fix linker duplicate symbol errors, add missing includes to LINUXaudio.c (stdlib.h, string.h, sys/ioctl.h). Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Level editor
description: Port level editor: block palette, draw/erase mouse controls, grid constraints (15 editable rows), play-test mode, board flip/scroll operations, save/load integration.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing).

title: Port level editor
description: Port editor.c: 5 states (LEVEL, NONE, TEST, WAIT, FINISH). Block palette (EDITOR_TOOL_WIDTH=120px), draw/erase mouse controls, grid constraints (MAX_ROW_EDIT=15 editable rows, bottom 3 reserved). Key controls: Q=quit, R=redraw, L=load, S=save, T=time, N=name, P=play-test, C=clear, H/V=flip, Shift-H/V=scroll. Play-test mode with temp file.

title: Game loop and input system
description: Implement fixed-timestep game loop with SDL2 timing and vsync. SDL2 event handling with action mapping layer for rebindable controls. 9 speed levels via logic tick rate instead of sleep hacking.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). State machine and input dispatch tests must exist before refactoring the game loop.

title: Implement fixed-timestep game loop
description: Replace XPending/XPeekEvent/usleep loop with fixed-timestep pattern: accumulate time via SDL_GetTicks64, step physics in fixed increments, render at display rate with vsync (SDL_RENDERER_PRESENTVSYNC). 9 speed levels adjust logic tick interval (FAST_SPEED=5ms to SLOW_SPEED=30ms) instead of sleep duration. Pause uses SDL_WaitEvent.

title: Implement state machine with function pointer dispatch
description: Refactor switch(mode) in handleGameStates into function pointer table: void (*modeHandlers[16])(...). Same 16 modes (MODE_NONE through MODE_KEYSEDIT). Add centralized transitionMode(old, new) with enterMode/exitMode hooks replacing scattered Reset*() calls in key handlers.

title: Implement SDL2 input with action mapping
description: Replace XKeySym switch dispatch with action mapping layer. Define game actions (ACTION_LEFT, ACTION_RIGHT, ACTION_SHOOT, ACTION_PAUSE, ACTION_TILT, etc). Map SDL scancodes to actions in a config table. Same default bindings (Left/J=left, Right/L=right, K=shoot, P=pause, T=tilt, etc). Mouse input for paddle (CONTROL_MOUSE mode) via SDL_GetMouseState. Rebindable via config file.

title: Code quality passes
description: Incremental clang-format, clang-tidy, and cppcheck passes across the codebase. One module at a time, format-only commits separated from logic changes. Track per-file warning suppressions as beads.

title: task
description: Apply clang-format to: ball.c, blocks.c, paddle.c, gun.c, score.c, bonus.c, level.c, special.c, file.c and their headers. One module per commit, format-only changes. Verify no behavior change via ctest.

title: task
description: Apply clang-format to: main.c, init.c, stage.c, sfx.c, misc.c, error.c, mess.c, dialogue.c, editor.c, highscore.c, presents.c, intro.c, inst.c, demo.c, preview.c, keys.c, keysedit.c, eyedude.c and their headers. One module per commit.

title: task
description: Run clang-tidy with modernize-* and readability-* checks. Apply auto-fixable changes one module at a time. Manual review for each module. Commit separately from format changes.

title: task
description: Run cppcheck --enable=warning,style,performance,portability across entire codebase. Triage findings, fix genuine issues, suppress false positives with inline comments. Target: zero cppcheck warnings.

title: chore
description: Audit all sprintf, strcpy, strcat calls and replace with bounded versions (snprintf, strncpy, strncat). Required for distro security review. One module per commit.

title: UI screens and animation sequences
description: Port all UI screens: presents, intro, instructions, demo, preview, keys, keysedit, high score display, dialogue system. Same state sequences and timing, rendered via SDL2.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). UI screen state sequences should be documented/tested before porting to SDL2.

title: Port presents sequence
description: Port presents.c: 13-state sequence (flag, text phases, letters, shine, special text, clear, finish). Letter-by-letter rendering, star sparkle animation (11 frames), character-by-character text reveal. Same timing: flag 800 frames, letters 300 each, etc.

title: Port intro and instructions screens
description: Port intro.c (6 states: title, blocks, text, explode, finish, wait) and inst.c (5 states). Star animation, block type showcase, multi-paragraph instruction text. Window shatter effect on transition. End frames: intro 3000, instructions 7000.

title: Port demo and preview screens
description: Port demo.c (6 states) loading demo.data with ball/paddle tutorial visualization. Port preview.c (4 states) with random level display, background rotation, 5000 frame timeout.

title: Port keys and keysedit display screens
description: Port keys.c (5 states): two-column control listing, mouse diagram pixmap (35x57), arrow pixmaps. Port keysedit.c (5 states): editor instructions and control listing. Both have sparkle animation and 4000 frame end timers.

title: Port dialogue system
description: Port dialogue.c: modal input dialog (380x120). 4 validation types: TEXT_ENTRY, NUMERIC_ENTRY, ALL_ENTRY, YES_NO_ENTRY. 5 states (MAP, TEXT, UNMAP, NONE, FINISHED). Fade effect on dismiss. Character validation, backspace, escape cancel, return submit.

title: Port high score display
description: Port highscore.c display: 5 states (TITLE, SHOW, WAIT, SPARKLE, FINISH). Title with star sparkle, earth pixmap, 10-row score table with column layout (rank, score, level, time, date, name). Color coding for current score. Score row sparkle animation.

title: Port message display system
description: Port mess.c: centered green text in message region, CLEAR_DELAY=2000 auto-clear, auto-revert to level name. SetCurrentMessage with persistent/auto-hide modes.

title: Capture game screenshots
description: Screenshots of XBoing in action: blocks, demo, editor, gameplay, instructions, keys, preview, and scores screens. Located in screenshots/ directory as GIF files.

title: Add project configuration files
description: Add CLAUDE.md (project instructions for Claude Code), AGENTS.md (beads workflow), .beads/ tracker database, .gitattributes. These configure the development tooling for the project.

title: Modernize XBoing for current Linux systems
description: Initial modernization: Makefile rewrite for gcc/Linux, ALSA audio driver, TrueColor display compatibility fixes, sleepSync timing calibration, .gitignore, xboing.sh launch script. Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Add .gitignore and launch script
description: Add .gitignore for build artifacts (*.o, xboing binary, generated files). Add xboing.sh launcher script with -usedefcmap and -sound flags as default invocation. Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Write SDL2 modernization plan
description: Created docs/MODERNIZATION.md documenting from-to architectural changes for an SDL2-based rewrite: graphics/windowing, audio, build system (Meson), game loop (fixed timestep), data formats (JSON/SQLite), XDG paths, distro packaging (.deb, AppStream, .desktop). Preserves original gameplay constants and physics. Ref: commit 7ee1dbb.

title: Build system and project infrastructure
description: Set up Meson build system, XDG path resolution, and SDL2 dependency integration. This is the foundation — every other epic depends on a working build.

title: Set up Meson build system with SDL2 dependencies
description: Create meson.build with pkg-config dependencies: sdl2, SDL2_image, SDL2_mixer, SDL2_ttf. Define project version, C standard (C99), compiler warnings. Generate build directory. Replace Makefile entirely.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DECISION NEEDED: CLAUDE-c-game.md specifies CMake, but MODERNIZATION.md proposed Meson. This needs a DESIGN.md decision record before proceeding. The safety net epic xboing-91a is using CMake — this task should align. Consider renaming to CMake or creating a DESIGN.md entry for the build system choice.

title: Implement XDG Base Directory path resolution
description: Runtime path resolution using XDG spec: data files from XDG_DATA_DIRS/xboing/ (levels, sounds, images), config from XDG_CONFIG_HOME/xboing/, scores/saves in XDG_DATA_HOME/xboing/. Fallback to relative paths for development. Replaces all compile-time HIGH_SCORE_FILE, LEVEL_INSTALL_DIR, SOUNDS_DIR defines.

title: Add FHS-compliant install targets to Meson
description: Configure meson install_data() for assets to /usr/share/xboing/, binary to /usr/games/xboing. Support DESTDIR for packaging. Ensure game finds assets at both installed and development paths.

title: Write Makefile for modern Linux
description: Replace Imakefile/Makefile.std with new Makefile: gcc with -O2 -Wall, -I./include -I/usr/include/X11, -lXpm -lX11 -lm linking, audio.c symlink generation, version.c from version.sh, clean target. Ref: commit ad06385.

title: Characterization testing
description: Write tests that capture current behavior of critical subsystems BEFORE any modernization. These tests prove equivalence when subsystems are later replaced. NOTE: timing/speed behavior on current hardware is NOT canonical — the original game speed was dictated by vintage 1993 hardware and we have only approximated it. Characterization tests must focus on hardware-independent pure logic. Timing calibration requires user input from someone who played the original.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests capturing current behavior of: paddle collision geometry (line intersection math), block collision (4-region point-in-triangle), ball-to-ball collision (quadratic equation + momentum exchange), velocity clamping, trajectory stepping. These are pure math — hardware-independent and safe to characterize.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests for: block point values by type, score multiplier logic (x2 lasts 25 blocks, x4 lasts 15), bonus sequence calculations (BONUS_COIN=3000, BULLET_SCORE=500, LEVEL_SCORE=100, TIME_BONUS=100/sec, SUPER_BONUS=50000), extra life threshold (every 100,000 points). Pure arithmetic — no X11 dependency.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests for: ReadNextLevel() character-to-block-type mapping (all 30+ characters), level file format parsing (title, time limit, 15 grid rows), level wrapping at MAX_NUM_LEVELS. Use actual level files from levels/ directory as test fixtures.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests for: saveGameStruct serialization round-trip, high score file format read/write round-trip, field preservation (score, level, lives, bullets, paddle size, etc.). Verify byte-level compatibility with existing save format.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests for: all 30 block types (hitPoints, point values, dimensions), block grid setup (18x9), explosion chain logic (BOMB adjacency), counter block decrement behavior, special block hit requirements (SHOTS_TO_KILL_SPECIAL=3). Pure data and logic — no rendering.

title: task
description: Write CMocka tests for: mode transition sequences (PRESENTS→INTRO→cycle→GAME), valid/invalid transitions, entry/exit side effects per mode. May require extracting the state machine dispatch into a testable function with mocked subsystems.

title: Write comprehensive game specification document
description: Created docs/SPECIFICATION.md (1630 lines, 16 sections) covering every subsystem: build system, X11 graphics, audio, state machine, ball physics, blocks, paddle, guns, scoring, specials, levels, editor, high scores, save/load, UI screens, and module dependencies. All constants verified against source. Ref: commit 5303870.

title: Core rendering engine
description: Replace Xlib rendering with SDL2: window creation, GPU-accelerated 2D renderer, texture loading from PNG, TTF font rendering, RGBA color system, cursor handling. Single window with logical regions replaces 9+ X11 sub-windows.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). Characterization tests for the rendering subsystem must exist before porting to SDL2, so we can prove equivalence after the port.

title: Create SDL2 window and renderer
description: Initialize SDL2, create single 565x710 window (matching original dimensions), create GPU-accelerated 2D renderer with vsync. Replace mainWindow, all 9+ sub-windows with logical render regions. Set window title, icon, size constraints.

title: Implement sprite/texture loading from PNG
description: Replace XPM loading (XpmCreatePixmapFromData) with SDL_image PNG loading. Create texture manager that loads all sprite sheets. Handle transparency via PNG alpha channel instead of XPM masks. Load all bitmap assets: balls/, blocks/, blockex/, paddle/, presents/, stars/, digits/, eyes/, guides/, guns/, bgrnds/.

title: Implement TTF font rendering
description: Replace 4 XLFD Helvetica bitmap fonts with SDL_ttf using bundled Liberation Sans (or similar). Match original sizes: title 24pt bold, text 18pt medium, data 14pt bold, copy 12pt medium. Implement DrawText, DrawShadowText, DrawShadowCentredText equivalents.

title: Implement RGBA color system
description: Replace PseudoColor colormap with direct RGBA colors. Define named colors (red, tan, yellow, green, white, black, blue, purple) as SDL_Color structs. Implement reds[7] and greens[7] gradient arrays as precomputed RGBA values for border glow and animations.

title: Implement cursor management
description: Replace XCreateFontCursor/XCreatePixmapCursor with SDL2 equivalents. 5 cursor types: wait (watch), plus (crosshair), point (hand), skull (pirate), none (invisible). ChangePointer() equivalent using SDL_SetCursor.

title: Implement logical render regions
description: Define render regions matching original sub-window layout: playArea (495x580 at 247,60), scoreArea (224x42 at 247,10), levelArea (224x52 at 496,5), messArea (247x30 at 247,655), specialArea (180x35 at 496,655), timeArea (61x35 at 682,655). Use SDL_RenderSetClipRect for region-scoped drawing.

title: Power-ups, specials, and visual effects
description: Port special effects system (shake/fade/blind/shatter), power-up states, bonus sequence, border glow, devil eyes, EyeDude character. SDL blend modes replace GC blend modes.

comments.author: J F
comments.text: DEPENDENCY UPDATE: This epic is now also blocked by xboing-n9e (Characterization testing). Power-up behavior and special effects must be characterized before porting.

title: Port special effects system
description: Port special.c: 8 active specials (reverse, sticky, save, fastGun, noWall, killer, x2, x4) with display panel. TurnSpecialsOff at each level. FLASH=500ms. Yellow=active, white=inactive text indicators in specialArea region.

title: Port bonus sequence
description: Port bonus.c: 10-state sequence (TEXT through FINISH). Same score constants: BONUS_COIN=3000, SUPER_BONUS=50000, BULLET_SCORE=500, LEVEL_SCORE=100, TIME_BONUS=100/sec. MAX_BONUS=8 threshold. Ball border animation, floppy disk save icon every 5 levels.

title: Port visual SFX modes
description: Port sfx.c: 5 effect modes (SHAKE, FADE, BLIND, SHATTER, STATIC). Shake: move play region +/-3px every 5 frames. Fade: 12px grid lines. Blind: 8-section vertical strip copy. Shatter: 10x10 scatter grid with randomized chunks. Implement via SDL render-to-texture and clip rect manipulation.

title: Port border glow and devil eyes
description: Port border glow animation: update every 40 frames, cycle through reds[7]/greens[7] gradients. Green when noWalls active. Port devil eyes: 6 frames (57x16), 26-step blink sequence, positioned bottom-right of play area.

title: Port EyeDude animated character
description: Port eyedude.c: 32x32 character, 6 walk frames per direction, EYEDUDE_FRAME_RATE=30, +/-5px movement. Random direction, 30% turn chance at midpoint. Clear path check on top row. EYEDUDE_HIT_BONUS=10000 points. Death state and ball/bullet collision.
